title: Around what year did the first atheist appear? - Quora

response.answer_text: You have it backwards. You should really be asking, “Around what year did the first theists appear?”. In which the answer to that would be roughly between 100,000 to 50,000 years ago (give or take out of the entire on-going 4 billion year evolutionary history of life on Earth) when certain superstitious members of a species of African great ape that’s been around for only 200,000 to 300,000 years called Homo sapiens invented theism/religion, and countless other superstitions out of their own ignorance to help them explain the unknown, albeit very poorly and incorrectly. Atheism on the other hand has always been here, and always will be here. Every past, present, and future human was, is, and will be born an atheist due to being born without an automatic and instinctive belief in gods and/or gods and all other associated supernatural beings, places, forces, phenomena, and concepts. And/or beliefs in anything and everything else for that matter. By definition and extension, this also means that every past, present, and future nonhuman organisms/species (or to be even more specific, non-Homo sapiens species, since there have been many species of humans that existed over most of the past 7 million years of human evolution on the hominin family tree) was, is, and will be atheists due to not having the “god” concept as part of their mentality and behavior throughout their entire lives. Therefore, atheism is the default mental state. Theism/religion on the other hand, has to be brainwashed into people by other people before they are old enough to analytically, critically, honestly, rationally, and skeptically think for themselves. My 2 cents.

Q: Around what year did the first atheist appear? A: Around 88,000 years ago. Her name was Ngyla. You have never heard of her. She lived in a tribe in the middle-east some 88,000 years ago. Her fellow tribesman Geng had discovered that if you walked clockwise (not that there were any clocks) around the big rock outside their cave, it once rained. Geng has since made more elaborated ways of walking around the rock, and now he has made the conclusion that the Rock God makes it rain if you appease it with dances and offerings of food through him. One day Geng said to Ngyla, “Geng high priest of rock god. Ngyla must give berries and nookie to Geng, or rock god angry.” Then Ngyla said “Geng stuff rock god up own arse. Rock is rock. Geng is stupid. Ngyla not believe in rock god.” And thus Ngyla was the first ever atheist.  Well, not exactly, but sometime after one of our cave-dwelling ancestors said “there are gods and we must appease them”, another cave-dwelling ancestor said “I don’t believe you.” We may never know whom or when, but as long as there has been religion, there have been people who said “stuff it, you silly sod”. And the only way to stop them seems to be to get in power so you can burn the “stuff it, you silly sod”-people at the stake for insulting whatever god the people in power profess to believe in. So it is also rather likely that Ngyla was the first victim of the first inquisition.

Hello Arsène, in the first instance I trust that you are enjoying your retirement, or at least your break from the beautiful game. Now you are asking me who was the first Arsenal fan who had stopped believing in you. As I am not personally acquainted with all the 27 million world wide fan-base, it is really difficult to say. But to begin with, let me attempt to ascertain when exactly you first became a deity. When you were appointed as Arsenal manager in the September 1996, you stated that the principal reason for accepting the position was that you loved English football. As for the club captain, Tony Adams’ opinion of you, he was unimpressed. He mentioned something about your wearing glasses and looking like a school teacher. However, you went on to achieve great things. I would imagine that it was around the turn of the twenty first century that you became a god. You won the Premier League in 1998, 2002 and 2004. You won the FA Cup in 1998, 2002, 2003, 2005, 2014, 2015, and 2017. The honors that have been heaped on you over the years is quite frankly breathtaking. Officer of the Order of the British Empire (2003), Legion d’Honneur (2004), and if I were to list all the football honors, I would be here all night. It is scarcely surprising that at least somewhere, someone had you dietized. I would point out that it was only in the past few years that people stopped believing in you. Although you appeared to finish in the top four forever, those results were not quite what were expected of a god. In other words they became atheists. As for the exact year, this is open to question. No doubt it was these fans straying into paganism that influenced your decision to hang up your boots. To conclude Arsène, you were a fantastic manager, and one who did great things for my favorite football club of all time. Unfortunately I have to end on a sad note. We are not doing so well at the moment. Would you like to come back?  This is a great picture of you.

To answer this question one should have a good knowledge of the History of Religion. By studying ancient texts one comes to know that to the ancients “god” meant “lord”. So, as long as the lords were earthly lords and not heavenly gods, no one had any reason to doubt the existence of the tyrannical lords, who were killing and raping their subjects. By 15k years ago, at the latest, the tyrannical lords lost the power to their slaves and had to leave the area (the ancient Near East). It was then that it was said, to those chasing the fleeing lords, that the lords had climbed ladders and went to live on the clouds. The dating of the deification of the lords is based on the fact that the American Indians, who had been living isolated for approximately 12k years, knew of the existence of the “heavenly people”. Therefore, the first atheists were the same ones who had created the gods, i.e. those who had said that the lords went to live in the sky. Since then, and up to this date, the royals and the archbishops and popes are all of them secretly atheists because they are the descendants of the original frauds. Dimitrios Trimijopulos's answer to Is the God idea a positive fraud?

As long as there is such a thing as a human. Everyone is born atheist. Every single person ever. Because god is a human invention to describe what we didn’t understand. Babies and animals and plants have no concept of a god. They are all atheists. People become theists by influence of others. Always. Since the homo-sapiens is estimated to have first appeared around 300,000 years ago, the first human atheist appeared around this time. The tricky thing about evolution though, is that we cannot date precisely when a species first appears. It’s not a black and white kind of thing, it’s more like a gradient. So if the homo-sapiens first appeared 300K years ago, it means that he was virtually indistinguishable from the homo-heidelbergensis, which is its predecessor. I’ll guarantee that the homo-heidelbergensis were also atheists.

First you would need to determine at what point in time did Man first create God. Modern humans have been around for 200 to 300 thousand years. It is unlikely that anyone thought up the idea of a ‘god’ until comparatively recently, probably within the last ten thousand years. So the human mind was free of god belief for hundreds of thousands of years… effectively all humans were atheists. Even now, all humans are obviously born atheist, and it is not until they have been convinced by their elders and teachers that they should believe in the god myth. Fortunately a growing percentage of the human race no longer inflict such ideas upon their children, allowing them to live with a free mind… Slowly the World is healing.

“Around what year did the first atheist appear?” For humans? Around 200,000 years ago. Well before man had the time or intellect enough to create gods or the idea of religion. We’re all born atheists until indoctrinated or until we decide that a god or gods must exist and indoctrinate others into the belief. None of us pops out of the womb believing in a god.

When the first primitive man (or woman) who had the power of speech said something about a god, and someone else didn’t believe in that god. Since we began speaking about 1.2 million years ago, I’d guess it was around that year. (Atheism is merely not believing in gods. Period. No more. Technically [and trivially] a chair is an atheist - it has no belief in any god. The definition doesn’t require a possibility of belief.)

No doubt, about the same time as the first theist. As Newton stated, “for every action there is an equal and opposite reaction”. One says that Boreas is the wind, another says “show me” and finds no Boreas. Unfortunately the theists (and other adherents to ‘isms’), receiving no support for their beliefs from a deity, nor from reality, seek to find it by chopping the heads of unbelievers, whether in the form of wars, jihads, crusades or other ventures bent on finding concurrence by chopping off heads.

At the dawn of humanity, there has never been a time when there weren’t people who lacked a belief in god/s.A better question might have been when did the first theist appear, then the answer becomes a bit harder to answer, would it mean those cavemen who worshipped the sun? or maybe those who lived in forests who worshipped some mythical animal gods.

Everyone is born an atheist. It's our parents who fill our heads with beliefs in mythical creatures. Most of us eventually figure out that santa, the tooth fairy and the Easter bunny, are not real, but many cling to the belief that God is real. It provides a false sense of security and allows us to overcome our instinctive fear of death.

Around about the time the first self-replicating molecule developed to the point that it could reasonably be called “alive.” All living organisms, including all human beings, are born lacking belief in anything, including all theistic claims. That makes them atheists.

Everyone born is an atheist. They must be indoctrinated in religion. I suppose the first atheist appeared in the Middle Paleolithic, about 200,000 years ago such as the Omo remains of Ethiopia; later fossils from Es Skhul cave in Israel and Southern Europe begin around 90,000 years ago (0.09 million years ago).

Everyone is born an atheist. To become a theist you need religion beaten into you, either with threat or actual violence or through a process like hypnosis or brain washing where you are taught to never question anything, you know like the poor people in N Korea. In short, everyone is born atheist, you must be forced to learn nonsense to become theist.
The first person was the first atheist. Gods and theism were invented later.

Trick question. There are no atheists. Atheism, you see, is clearly defined as Pretending to not believe in God, in order to live a life of denial, hedonism, and sin. Preferably with a confused young Goth girl.

To be an Atheist a sort of Theism is necessary. Theism in our meaning originated in the West roughly in 7th cent. bC. In India the Jainism is an atheistic religion. It is assumed that he existed already in the 5th. cent bC.
That would be the year the first human appeared, since everyone is born atheist. Then one smart caveman invented the first religion and the rest was history!
Since we are all born atheist, the first atheist was born when the first human was born.
That is impossible to Answer that's like asking Around what time was time created.
At the exact moment someone proposed the idea of gods. There have always been people with higher than average rationality.
